title: Upvote so Riot can see. Can we give Zoe's E the Fizz ult treatment? Opinions?
body:
Right now, if a Fizz ults and hit somebody, the  shark latches on to them and they take the damage, but in a past change they changed the Fizz ult that if he missed, the shark will be on the ground and it cannot be latched onto a target but if they still stand on top of it they take the damage which is a healthy change, it offers counterplay. It forces the Fizz to aim better to make sure the shark hits somebody directly or the Fizz risks his ultimate dealing no damage.

But this ain't the case with a Zoe E. First of all, a Zoe E is faster than a Fizz ult in speed, it can also travel continuosly over the same piece of terrain which a Fizz ult cannot and even if she misses the E, there is a zoning field that no one can walk over for 4 seconds or else they get put to sleep which is ridiculous and this is what I want changed.

Changes:
If Zoe hits her E and it hits someone directly fair enough, but if she misses her E allow enemy champions to walk over the field for 3 seconds, only the last second of the field will sleep the enemy target, change the color of the field on the last second to let enemy champions know this is a sleep zone, you will be put to sleep if you are still stood over it. This offers counterplay and allows enemy champions some breathing room.

Why:
It gives Zoe's E more skill to hit directly, or she risks not putting anybody to sleep. She has to rely on her teammates with slows and stuns to keep enemy champions on top of the sleep zone so she can chain their CC with her own for her full damage combo.
Her E should be a reward for being a skillful player because right now, any Zoe player can make any enemy champion go to sleep even if they have bad skillshot cos of the zone that offers no counterplay.

What do you guys think?

replies.body:
3 seconds of counterplsy is insane.

How about the 1st second cant sleep and the last 3 can.

> 3 seconds of counterplsy is insane.

She shouldn't have missed it. It's not counterplay, it's punishment for missing skillshot, she should get rewarded for hitting it, not missing, how it is right now. It SHOULD be easy to deal with when it's missed.

She doesn't get rewarded for missing it unless your either drunk or have the motor skills of a semi-dead tadpole. It's no better than a cait trap and worse in many cases. 

- single target
- huge aoe
- triggered by minions

That last point is one people love to forget and its a huge point when considering her E balance. She can't zone you unless the path is clear. Anything with a hitbox can trigger it so in lane it doesn't get much zoning power. So can we please stop pretending that as soon as zoe puts down a bubble its "gg can't move from this spot now". Most times people I see (_in BRONZE_) get hit by the trap because they turn around for no damn reason. It's mainly persons on obvious title that fall for it if I miss the projectile itself. Same with my zoe same with the enemy zoe. I have _rarely_ ever get hit by the trap and legitimately felt like i got bullshitted.

The thing is that you can barely see it coming cuz its morgana bind cc but its way faster and can go through walls, so If you barely dodge it by reacting fast you can still get hit by it cuz it drops on the ground and ur still in the vicinity because you barely dodged it. what are you supposed to do then? either she misses by a long shot or you die or ur out of a fight.

>The thing is that you can barely see it coming cuz its morgana bind cc but its way faster and can go through walls

Let's not go down this road and start saying "X is Y but it does B better". Let's just clarify. Morgana bind is morgana bind, zoe bubble is zoe bubble. They don't work the same way other than both are skillshots - like a hundred other abilities in the game and both are hard CC like another hundred abilities in the game. Just that one is a root and the other is an easily removable version of  stun.

>so If you barely dodge it by reacting fast you can still get hit by it cuz it drops on the ground and ur still in the vicinity because you barely dodged it

Or you could walk away? If you see Zoe around and you don't keep the fact that she has her E up in mind that's on you. The only exception is when it's from offscreen then it'd be understandable. Once you dodge the projectile for the E I have no sympathy for you if you get hit by the bubble because it doesn't even go on the ground instantly. It's like Kat's daggers. If you see the first cast you can tell _exactly_ where it will land. It's not even good at Zoning that well in lane if your good at watching your own minions.

>either she misses by a long shot or you die or ur out of a fight.

Basically you either predict her bubble or get punished because you got hit by hard cc. We can both play the over simplify game, dude.
But why should she get a trap in the first place?

So she isn't literally just there for damage.

It allows you to provide some zone denial, cutting off escape much like Lux E, Cass W, Fizz R, Gragas Q, Karma RQ, Morg W, Ziggs E, Zyra plants, and others.

It's hardly even a trap.  It can't even stay on the ground as long as a Lux E.
And she wouldn't be there "just for damage" without a trap. She'd still have  a CC thats enhanced over walls. And massive (variable) utility due to her W.
Her E almost literally only works as CC in 1v1s and picks; any other time it gets popped as soon as it starts.

If she doesn't have the bubble the champion goes to utter shit I would say. It's a _single_ target cc that's a blockable skillshot. If she misses her first cast for the E she only realistically has one option to do _anything_ if she doesn't have a spell. She can Q you and that's about it.  Ult is useless because if you're going to engage her at that time she is only going to root herself by using it. If she didn't have the trap the risk of using it and missing is a tad too over bearing. At the very least with the trap you can get some safety from the zone you make.
There's a lot of single target, body blockable, CC though. Ahri E, LB E, Morg Q, etc... yet they don't get any special effects for missing their CC.

Perfect. I didn't want to bring up ahri because you might of said something along the lines of "stop comparing everything to ahri" but since you're the one who did it this should be fine. 

As I said Zoe has no other safety options other than E and W is very unreliable. All the champs you mentioned have other forms of safety options. Ahri has ms on Q and can hold on to her ult until needed unlike Zoe that can only hold onto a flash for so long and it isn't even guaranteed she gets a flash, LB has 2 dashes and morg has her spell shield. They don't get any special effects because there safety isn't loaded into just one skill.
Brand Q is more dangerous to set up with no reward for missing, yet he has no safety either. I had just picked the first few champions off the top of my head in my last examples.

Brands spells have one of the best kit synergies in the game. If he doesn't hit the stun he still has enough damage potential for you to be extremely weary of an all in. That and he also builds/built and is/was balanced around {{item:3116}}

It's not this "rewarded for missing" thing people are pushing.  It's a trap but it has a short duration and visible, it's worse than a Shaco Box, it's worse than Teemo Shroom, etc.   It's already a bad trap that IS easy to deal with, so unlike those, it arms instantly so you can hit people with it as well.

Ok but how is she _not _rewarded for missing it? The fact remains that the skillshot persists when missed. The counterplay to skillshots are that they are missable, meaning, dodging a skillshot should always render that skillshot useless. But with Zoe's E, dodging is not enough. Especially when you have a clusterfuck 5v5 brawl going on, someone's going to trip it just based on probability. 

You yourself say that it's a trap. It's a trap and a skillshot. With an extremely short arming time. This is the EXACT reason Fizz's cancerous ult was changed. Because it was a skillshot and an instantly arming trap. At the very least we should be consistent and give her E a 1.5 secod arm time or something.

Not being punished and being rewarded are completely different things and you all need to acknowledge that before you use terminology that doesn't make sense. A reward implies that that specific outcome is better than the alternative. Saying she is rewarded for missing IMPLIES that missing has a better outcome than hitting the target which is a completely false statement. She is not PUNISHED for missing because it leaves a field on the ground where it stops. The last part is important since 90% of the time when she misses the E it is like 300 units behind you and you can freely run her down since she is a champion with zero escapes in her entire kit.

Miss any other skillshot (besides fizz's ult maybe) and you aren't rewarded for it. Of course,she's rewarded more if she simply hits the skillshot, but that's the difference between being awarded $500 for making a basket and $250 for hitting the rim. You're still being rewarded in either case.

Good Zoe's will be rewarded, bad ones will have a large open window to be traded with.
